definition:
Gaslighting is a
colloquialism that is loosely defined as making someone question their
reality. The term is also used informally to describe someone (a
'gaslighter') who persistently puts forth a false narrative which
leads another person (or a group of people) to doubt their own
perceptions to the extent that they become disoriented and distressed.
This dynamic is generally only possible when the audience is
vulnerable such as in unequal power relationships or when the audience
is fearful of the losses associated with challenging the false
narrative. Gaslighting is not necessarily malicious or intentional,
although in some cases it is. [from Wikipedia]
